meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being subservient or subordinate.
meanings.sent1: Her subserviency to her boss was evident in how she always followed his orders without question.
meanings.sent2: The subserviency of the assistant to the manager ensured smooth operations in the office.
meanings.sent3: The robot's subserviency to its human owner led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: In the kingdom of ants, the subserviency of the worker ants to the queen is crucial for survival.
meanings.sent5: The subserviency of the soldier to his commanding officer was unwavering and admirable.

meanings.definition: The state of being useful or helpful in achieving a particular goal.
meanings.sent1: The subserviency of the tool in fixing the car made the job much easier.
meanings.sent2: Her subserviency in organizing the event ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The subserviency of the map in guiding us through the forest was invaluable.
meanings.sent4: The subserviency of the calculator in solving complex equations saved us a lot of time.
meanings.sent5: The subserviency of the flashlight in lighting up the dark room was greatly appreciated.

meanings.definition: The act of serving or obeying someone in a submissive manner.
meanings.sent1: His subserviency to his parents was evident in how he always did as they asked.
meanings.sent2: The maid's subserviency to the wealthy family was expected and appreciated.
meanings.sent3: The dog's subserviency to its owner sometimes bordered on comedic.
meanings.sent4: The subserviency of the loyal knight to his king was unwavering and true.
meanings.sent5: The subserviency of the student to the teacher was a sign of respect and discipline.
